content.text:
[Verse 1: Zac Efron]
N.C.

                         [ch]Eb[/ch]

                      [ch]F[/ch]

                       [ch]Gm[/ch]
But you're here in my heart
                      [ch]Eb[/ch]
So who can stop me if I decide
That you're my destiny?

[Chorus: Zac Efron]
            [ch]Gm[/ch]           [ch]Eb[/ch]
What if we rewrite the stars?
             [ch]Bb[/ch]         [ch]F[/ch]
Say you were made to be mine
              [ch]Gm[/ch]       [ch]Eb[/ch]
Nothing could keep us apart
             [ch]Bb[/ch]                   [ch]F[/ch]
You'd be the one I was meant to find
            [ch]Gm[/ch]                 [ch]Eb[/ch]
It's up to you, and it's up to me
            [ch]Bb[/ch]                [ch]F[/ch]
No one can say what we get to be
                 [ch]Gm[/ch]            [ch]Eb[/ch]
So why don't we rewrite the stars?
           [ch]Bb[/ch]             [ch]F[/ch]
Maybe the world could be ours
[ch]Bb[/ch]      [ch]Cm[/ch] [ch]Gm[/ch] [ch]F[/ch]
Tonight

[Verse 2: Zendaya]
[ch]Bb[/ch]
You think it's easy
[ch]Bb[/ch]
You think I don't want to run to you
[ch]Bb[/ch]
But there are mountains
                                       [ch]Eb[/ch]
And there are doors that we can't walk through
[ch]F[/ch]                       [ch]Gm[/ch]
I know you're wondering why
                       [ch]Eb[/ch]
Because we're able to be
Just you and me
               [ch]F[/ch]
Within these walls
                 [ch]Gm[/ch]
But when we go outside
                            [ch]Eb[/ch]
You're going to wake up and see that it was hopeless after all

[Chorus: Zendaya]
             [ch]Gm[/ch]          [ch]Eb[/ch]
No one can rewrite the stars
             [ch]Bb[/ch]            [ch]F[/ch]
How can you say you'll be mine?
             [ch]Gm[/ch]     [ch]Eb[/ch]
Everything keeps us apart
                [ch]Bb[/ch]                       [ch]F[/ch]
And I'm not the one you were meant to find
                [ch]Gm[/ch]
It's not up to you
               [ch]Eb[/ch]
It's not up to me
               [ch]Bb[/ch]                  [ch]F[/ch]
When everyone tells us what we can be
            [ch]Gm[/ch]           [ch]Eb[/ch]
How can we rewrite the stars?
              [ch]Bb[/ch]          [ch]F[/ch]
Say that the world can be ours
Tonight

[Verse 3: Zac Efron and Zendaya]
[ch]Gm[/ch]               [ch]Eb[/ch]
All I want is to fly with you
[ch]Bb[/ch]               [ch]F[/ch]
All I want is to fall with you
[ch]Gm[/ch]              [ch]Dm[/ch]       [ch]Eb[/ch]
So just give me all of you

[Zendaya]
It feels impossible
[Zac Efron]
It's not impossible
[Zendaya]
Is it impossible?
[Both]
Say that it's possible

[Chorus: Zac Efron and Zendaya]
            [ch]Gm[/ch]          [ch]Eb[/ch]
How do we rewrite the stars?
             [ch]Bb[/ch]         [ch]F[/ch]
Say you were made to be mine?
             [ch]Gm[/ch]      [ch]Eb[/ch]
Nothing can keep us apart
                  [ch]Bb[/ch]                  [ch]F[/ch]
Cause you are the one I was meant to find
            [ch]Gm[/ch]
It's up to you
               [ch]Eb[/ch]
And it's up to me
            [ch]Bb[/ch]                 [ch]F[/ch]
No one can say what we get to be
                  [ch]Gm[/ch]            [ch]Eb[/ch]
And why don't we rewrite the stars?
              [ch]Bb[/ch]         [ch]F[/ch]
Changing the world to be ours

[ch]Bb[/ch] [ch]Gm[/ch] [ch]Eb[/ch] [ch]Bb[/ch]

[Outro: Zendaya]
[ch]Bb[/ch]
You know I want you
[ch]Bb[/ch]
It's not a secret I try to hide
[ch]Eb[/ch]            [ch]Bb[/ch]
But I can't have you
We're bound to break and
My hands are tied

content.text:
‘Under the Bridge’ by Red Hot Chili Peppers, released on September 24, 1991. The song was written by Vocalist 
Anthony Kiedis, the rest of the band wrote the music. The song expresses the feelings of loneliness and 
despondency, and to reflect on narcotics and their impact on his life. Kiedis initially did not feel 
"Under the Bridge" would fit into the Chili Peppers' repertoire and was reluctant to show it to his band mates 
until producer Rick Rubin implored him to do so. The song became a critical and commercial success, peaking at 
number two on the Billboard Hot 100 and later certified platinum by the Recording Industry Association of 
America. David Fricke of Rolling Stone said the song "unexpectedly drop-kicked the band into the Top 10", while 
Philip Booth of The Tampa Tribune commented that it was a "pretty, undulating, and by-now omnipresent single." 
Its success led in part to the departure of guitarist John Frusciante, who preferred the band to remain 
underground. ‘Under the Bridge’ follows ‘Give It Away’ as the band's second most performed live song, having 
been performed over 600 times.
